item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, January 26, 2025 at 4:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Steam Brick: No screen, no controller, just a power button and a USB port (338 points | 86 comments)
2. DeepSeek-R1: Incentivizing Reasoning Capability in LLMs via RL (571 points | 482 comments)

4. 7B Model and 8K Examples: Efficient and Effective Emerging Reasoning with RL (12 points | 3 comments)
5. OpenRA – Classic strategy games rebuilt for the modern era (311 points | 59 comments)
6. SQLook – A free online SQLite database manager with a Windows 2000 interface (63 points | 19 comments)
7. An invalid 68030 instruction accidentally allowed the Mac Classic II to boot (177 points | 21 comments)
8. Chimera Linux works toward a simplified desktop (36 points | 19 comments)

10. Searching for DeepSeek's glitch tokens (106 points | 18 comments)

13. Immutability Changes Everything (2016) [pdf] (69 points | 20 comments)

15. Using AI to develop a fuller model of the human brain (53 points | 13 comments)

25. Fault Tolerance in Tandem Computer Systems (1986)[pdf] (29 points | 20 comments)
26. Show HN: I built a DIY plane spotting system at home (165 points | 65 comments)
27. Schrödinger: The Nvidia biotech partner Jensen Huang told to "think bigger" (38 points | 22 comments)
28. How to Build an Artificial Synapse (4 points | discuss)
29. Show HN: Puck 0.18 adds drag-and-drop for CSS grid and Flexbox (38 points | 4 comments)
30. OpenAI's o1 Playing Codenames (209 points | 119 comments)
